definitions.definition: An imaginary great circle around Earth, equidistant from the two poles, and dividing earth's surface into the northern and southern hemispheres .
A similar great circle on any sphere , especially on a celestial body , or on another reasonably symmetrical three-dimensional body.
The midline of any generally spherical object, such as a fruit or vegetable, that has identifiable poles.
examples: Slice the onion through the equator .

main_definition: ( geography , often “the Equator ” ) An imaginary great circle around Earth, equidistant from the two poles, and dividing earth's surface into the northern and southern hemispheres .
secondary_definitions: ( astronomy ) A similar great circle on any sphere , especially on a celestial body , or on another reasonably symmetrical three-dimensional body.
The midline of any generally spherical object, such as a fruit or vegetable, that has identifiable poles.
